org.knime.core.node.port.database

Class DatabaseConnectionSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.port.database.DatabaseConnectionSettings
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatabaseQueryConnectionSettings, DefaultDatabaseConnectionSettings

    public class DatabaseConnectionSettings
extends Object
    Author:
    Thomas Gabriel, University of Konstanz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BATCH_WRITE_SIZE
      Properties defines the number of rows written in on chunk into the database.
      static String CFG_STATEMENT
      Config for SQL statement.
      static StringHistory DATABASE_URLS
      Keeps the history of all database URLs.
      static StringHistory DRIVER_ORDER
      Keeps the history of all loaded driver and its order.
      static Integer FETCH_SIZE
      DriverManager fetch size to chunk specified number of rows while reading from database.

      • DatabaseConnectionSettings

        @Deprecated
public DatabaseConnectionSettings(String driver,
                                              String jdbcUrl,
                                              String user,
                                              String pass,
                                              String credName)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a default database connection object.
        Parameters:
        driver - the database driver
        jdbcUrl - database URL
        user - user name
        pass - password for user name
        credName - credential id from CredentialsProvider or null

      • DatabaseConnectionSettings

        @Deprecated
public DatabaseConnectionSettings(String driver,
                                              String jdbcUrl,
                                              String user,
                                              String pass,
                                              String credName,
                                              String timezone)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a default database connection object.
        Parameters:
        driver - the database driver
        jdbcUrl - database URL
        user - user name
        pass - password for user name
        credName - credential id from CredentialsProvider or null
        timezone - the TimeZone to correct data/time/timestamp fields
        Since:
        2.8

      • DatabaseConnectionSettings

        public DatabaseConnectionSettings(String dbIdentifier,
                                  String driver,
                                  String jdbcUrl,
                                  String user,
                                  String pass,
                                  String credName,
                                  String timezone)
        Create a default database connection object.
        Parameters:
        dbIdentifier - the unique database identifier used to retrieve the DatabaseUtility class ( see DatabaseUtility.getDatabaseIdentifier()) or null if the second part of the JDBC url should be used getDatabaseIdentifierFromJDBCUrl(String)
        driver - the database driver
        jdbcUrl - database URL
        user - user name
        pass - password for user name
        credName - credential id from CredentialsProvider or null
        timezone - the TimeZone to correct data/time/timestamp fields
        Since:
        2.11

      • DatabaseConnectionSettings

        public DatabaseConnectionSettings(ConfigRO config,
                                  CredentialsProvider cp)
                           throws InvalidSettingsException
        Creates and inits a new database configuration.
        Parameters:
        config - to load
        cp - CredentialProvider used to get user name/password, may be null
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if settings are invalid
        Since:
        2.7

      • DatabaseConnectionSettings

        public DatabaseConnectionSettings(DatabaseConnectionSettings conn)
        Creates a new DBConnection based on the given connection object.
        Parameters:
        conn - connection used to copy settings from
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the connection is null

    • Method Detail

      • getSystemPropertyDatabaseTimeout

        public static int getSystemPropertyDatabaseTimeout()
        Returns the database timeout set via the (deprecated) system property.
        Returns:
        timeout in seconds or -1 if not timeout is set
        Since:
        2.10

      • getDatabaseTimeout

        public static int getDatabaseTimeout()
        Returns the current database timeout in seconds. The timeout is usually controlled via a preference by may also be taken from the (deprecated) system property KNIMEConstants.PROPERTY_DATABASE_LOGIN_TIMEOUT in case no value has been set in the preferences yet.
        Returns:
        the timeout in seconds
        Since:
        2.10

      • setDatabaseTimeout

        public static void setDatabaseTimeout(int seconds)
        Sets the global database timeout. The timeout is mainly used for login but some drivers also use it for all other database operations.
        Parameters:
        seconds - timeout in seconds
        Since:
        2.10

      • createConnection

        @Deprecated
public Connection createConnection()
                                        throws InvalidSettingsException,
                                               SQLException,
                                               BadPaddingException,
                                               IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                               InvalidKeyException,
                                               IOException
        Deprecated. use createConnection(CredentialsProvider)
        Create a database connection based on this settings. Note, don't close the connection since it cached for subsequent calls or later reuse to same database URL (under the same user name).
        Returns:
        a new database connection object
        Throws:
        SQLException - SQLException
        InvalidSettingsException - InvalidSettingsException
        IllegalBlockSizeException - IllegalBlockSizeException
        BadPaddingException - BadPaddingException
        InvalidKeyException - InvalidKeyException
        IOException - IOException

      • createConnection

        public Connection createConnection(CredentialsProvider cp)
                            throws InvalidSettingsException,
                                   SQLException,
                                   BadPaddingException,
                                   IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                   InvalidKeyException,
                                   IOException
        Create a database connection based on this settings. Note, don't close the connection since it cached for subsequent calls or later reuse to same database URL (under the same user name).
        Parameters:
        cp - CredentialsProvider provides user/password pairs
        Returns:
        a new database connection object
        Throws:
        SQLException - SQLException
        InvalidSettingsException - InvalidSettingsException
        IllegalBlockSizeException - IllegalBlockSizeException
        BadPaddingException - BadPaddingException
        InvalidKeyException - InvalidKeyException
        IOException - IOException

      • syncConnection

        public final Object syncConnection(Connection conn)
        Used to sync access to all databases depending if SQL_CONCURRENCY is true.
        Parameters:
        conn - connection used to sync access to all databases
        Returns:
        sync object which is either the given connection or an new object (no sync necessary)
        Since:
        3.1

        Save settings.
        Parameters:
        settings - connection settings

                               CredentialsProvider cp)
                        throws InvalidSettingsException
        Validate settings.
        Parameters:
        settings - to validate
        cp - CredentialProvider used to get user name/password
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if the settings are not valid

      • loadValidatedConnection

        public boolean loadValidatedConnection(ConfigRO settings,
                                       CredentialsProvider cp)
                                throws InvalidSettingsException
        Load validated settings.
        Parameters:
        settings - to load
        cp - CredentialProvider used to get user name/password, may be null
        Returns:
        true, if settings have changed
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if settings are invalid

      • execute

        public void execute(String statement,
                    CredentialsProvider cp)
             throws InvalidKeyException,
                    BadPaddingException,
                    IllegalBlockSizeException,
                    InvalidSettingsException,
                    SQLException,
                    IOException
        Execute statement on current database connection.
        Parameters:
        statement - to be executed
        cp - CredentialsProvider providing user/password
        Throws:
        SQLException - SQLException
        InvalidSettingsException - InvalidSettingsException
        IllegalBlockSizeException - IllegalBlockSizeException
        BadPaddingException - BadPaddingException
        InvalidKeyException - InvalidKeyException
        IOException - IOException

      • setAutoCommit

        public static void setAutoCommit(Connection conn,
                                 boolean commit)
        Calls Connection.setAutoCommit(boolean) on the connection given the commit flag and catches all Exceptions, which is reported only once.
        Parameters:
        conn - the Connection to call auto commit on.
        commit - the commit flag.
        Since:
        3.1

      • createConnectionModel

        public ModelContentRO createConnectionModel()
        Create connection model with all settings used to create a database connection.
        Returns:
        database connection model

      • getDriver

        public final String getDriver()
        Returns:
        database driver used to open the connection

      • getDBName

        @Deprecated
public final String getDBName()
        Deprecated. use getJDBCUrl() instead
        Returns:
        database name used to access the database URL

      • getDatabaseIdentifier

        public String getDatabaseIdentifier()
        Returns the unique database identifier. Never returns null. if the database identifier is not specified the method return the identifier based on the url.
        Returns:
        the dbIdentifier the unique database identifier usually the second part of the JDBC url
        Since:
        2.11
        See Also:
        getDatabaseIdentifierFromJDBCUrl(String), setDatabaseIdentifier(String)

      • getDatabaseIdentifierValue

        public String getDatabaseIdentifierValue()
        Returns:
        the value of the database identifier. Might be null id the identifier should be determined based on the connection url.
        Since:
        2.11
        See Also:
        getDatabaseIdentifierFromJDBCUrl(String)

      • setDatabaseIdentifier

        public void setDatabaseIdentifier(String databaseIdentifier)
        Parameters:
        databaseIdentifier - the unique database identifier if null the second part of the JDBC url is used (see getDatabaseIdentifierFromJDBCUrl(String).
        Since:
        2.11

      • getJDBCUrl

        public final String getJDBCUrl()
        Returns the JDBC URL for the database.
        Returns:
        a JDBC URL
        Since:
        2.10

        Parameters:
        cp - CredentialsProvider
        Returns:
        user name used to login to the database

        public final String getPassword(CredentialsProvider cp)
        Parameters:
        cp - CredentialsProvider
        Returns:
        password (decrypted) used to login to the database

        Since:
        2.8

      • getTimeZoneOffset

        public final long getTimeZoneOffset(long date)
        Parameters:
        date - in the current date to compute the offset for
        Returns:
        the TimeZone correction, offset in milli seconds.
        Since:
        2.8

      • setUserName

      • setPassword

        public final void setPassword(String password)
        Set a new password.
        Parameters:
        password - (decrypted) used to login to the database

      • getCredentialName

        public final String getCredentialName()
        Returns the name of the credential entry that should be used. If null is returned username and password should be used instead.
        Returns:
        a credential identifier or null
        Since:
        2.10

      • setCredentialName

        public final void setCredentialName(String name)
        Returns the name of the credential entry that should be used. If it is set to null username and password should be used instead.
        Parameters:
        name - a credential identifier or null
        Since:
        2.10

      • getTimezone

        public final String getTimezone()
        Returns the manually set timezone that should be assumed for dates returned by the database. If the timezone is set to current the client's local timezone should be used. If the timezone is set to none no correction is applied
        Returns:
        a timezone identifier, current, or none
        Since:
        2.10

      • setTimezone

        public void setTimezone(String tz)
        Sets the manually set timezone that should be assumed for dates returned by the database. If the timezone is set to current the client's local timezone should be used. If the timezone is set to none no correction is applied
        Parameters:
        tz - a timezone identifier, current, or none
        Since:
        2.10

      • getValidateConnection

        public final boolean getValidateConnection()
        Returns whether the connection should be validated by dialogs.
        Returns:
        true if the connection should be validated, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.10

      • setValidateConnection

        public final void setValidateConnection(boolean b)
        Sets whether the connection should be validated by dialogs.
        Parameters:
        b - true if the connection should be validated, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.10

      • getRetrieveMetadataInConfigure

        public final boolean getRetrieveMetadataInConfigure()
        Returns whether the metadata for the current query should be retrieved during configure.
        Returns:
        true if metadata should be retrieved, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.10

      • setRetrieveMetadataInConfigure

        public final void setRetrieveMetadataInConfigure(boolean b)
        Sets whether the metadata for the current query should be retrieved during configure.
        Parameters:
        b - true if metadata should be retrieved, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.10

      • getAllowSpacesInColumnNames

        public boolean getAllowSpacesInColumnNames()
        Returns whether spaces in columns names are allowed and passed on to the database. If spaces are not allowed they will be replaced.
        Returns:
        true if spaces are allowed, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.10

      • setAllowSpacesInColumnNames

        public void setAllowSpacesInColumnNames(boolean allow)
        Sets whether spaces in columns names are allowed and passed on to the database. If spaces are not allowed they will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        allow - true if spaces are allowed, false otherwise
        Since:
        2.10

      • getRowIdsStartWithZero

        public boolean getRowIdsStartWithZero()
        Returns whether row IDs returned by a database reader should start with zero (correct behavior) or with (backward compatibility with pre 2.10). The default is false.
        Returns:
        true if row ids should start with 0, false if they should start with 1
        Since:
        2.10

      • setRowIdsStartWithZero

        public void setRowIdsStartWithZero(boolean b)
        Sets whether row IDs returned by a database reader should start with zero (correct behavior) or with (backward compatibility with pre 2.10). This should only be enabled for nodes that did not exist before 2.10.
        Parameters:
        b - true if row ids should start with 0, false if they should start with 1
        Since:
        2.10

      • getUtility

        public DatabaseUtility getUtility()
        Returns a utility implementation for the current database.
        Returns:
        a statement manipulator
        Since:
        2.10

      • getDatabaseIdentifierFromJDBCUrl

        public static String getDatabaseIdentifierFromJDBCUrl(String jdbcUrl)
        Parameters:
        jdbcUrl - the JDBC url must not be null
        Returns:
        the database identifier based on the given JDBC url
        Since:
        2.11
